text: The Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Performance, Duo or Group was presented from 1982 to 1990. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for works released in the previous year. ==Winners & Nominees== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! scope="col"|Year ! scope="col"|Winner(s) ! scope="col"|Title ! scope="col" class="unsortable"|Nominees ! scope="col" class="unsortable"|Ref. |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1982 | The Manhattan Transfer | "Until I Met You (Corner Pocket)" | | align="center"| |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1983 | The Manhattan Transfer | "Route 66" | | align="center"| |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1984 | The Manhattan Transfer | "Why Not!" | | align="center"| |- ! scope="row" align="center" style="text- align:center;"|1985 | colspan="4" style="text-align:center;"| No Award Given |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1986 | The Manhattan Transfer | Vocalese | | align="center"| |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1987 | Clare Fischer & His Latin Jazz Sextet | Free Fall | | align="center"| |- ! scope="row" align="center" style="text-align:center;"|1988 | colspan="4" style="text- align:center;"| No Award Given |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1989 | Take 6 | "Spread Love" | | align="center"| |- ! scope="row" align="center"|1990 | Dr. John, Rickie Lee Jones | "Makin' Whoopee" | | align="center"| |} ==References== Category:Grammy Awards for jazz
title: Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Performance, Duo or Group
